data.title: Nicaragua Population
data.meta_description: Nicaragua Population, Nicaragua Population in 2019, Nicaragua Population Density, Nicaragua Life Expectancy, Nicaragua Fertility Rate, Nicaragua Population by Religion, Nicaragua Population Global Rank, Nicaragua Population Growth Rate, Nicaragua population projection graph, Nicaragua Population projection by 2050
data.text:
Highlights of Analysis:

Nicaragua Population is increasing

Nicaragua Population Density is increasing

Nicaragua Life Expectancy is increasing

Nicaragua Fertility Rate is decreasing

Every year Nicaragua population is expected to increase by 14567 people. Nicaragua contributes 0.08% of world's total population. Average Life Expectancy in Nicaragua is 76.377 and is expected to Increase in upcoming next 50 years.Life Expectancy is above average when compared to global average (Currently Hong Kong Ranks 1st for Life Expectancy of 85 years). How the world population is changing is of great importance for humanity’s impact on the Earth’s natural environment, but it also gives reasons to hope for a good future. Nicaragua owns 0.00081% of land i.e. 120340 Sq Kms of land and Ranks 99 when compared to other Global Countries Land area

Nicaragua Population, Density, Fertility Rate and Life Expectancy Overview Nicaragua Population Analysis Year 2010 Year 2020 Year 2030 Nicaragua Population (in million) 5.73 6.41 7.04 Nicaragua Global Rank 110th 110th 109th Nicaragua Global Population Share 0.08% 0.08% 0.08% Nicaragua Global Population Density 49.06 56.3 62.24 Nicaragua Global Population Density Rank 142nd 144th 146th Nicaragua Average Life Expectancy 73.69 76.37 78.61 Nicaragua Average Life Expectancy Global Rank 90th 79th 72nd Nicaragua Fertility Rate 2.42 2.09 1.88 Nicaragua Fertility Rate Global Rank 101st 108th 117th

Note : Population Density means number of people staying per kilometer and Fertility rate means number of kids born per women

What is the Population trend of Nicaragua ?

Every year Nicaragua population is expected to increase by 14567 people.

Nicaragua population overall trend is expected to be Decreasing for next 50 years and expected to be in Decreasing trend for next 100 years.

As per trend analysis Nicaragua will have more death than births from 2067 and this will impact population growth.

Nicaragua Global Population Rank for next 50 years is expected to be in Range of 110th-116th.

What is the Population growth rate of Nicaragua ?

Nicaragua population average growth rate for next 50 years is increasing at Rate of 0.56%.

Overall population growth rate of Nicaragua is expected to be decreasing starting Year : 2062.

What percentage of worlds population lives in Nicaragua ?

Nicaragua contributes 0.08% of world's total population.

Nicaragua Population Density

What is the Population Density of Nicaragua ?

Nicaragua population density is 64.42 per sq. km and is expected to be Decreasing for next 50 years.

Nicaragua Ranks in range of 144th-152nd in term of population density around the world.

As per trend, their will be decrease in population density of Nicaragua.

Table : Past and Expected Future Population Density (people per sq. km.)

`

Year Population Density Rank 2010 49.06 142nd 2020 56.3 144th 2030 62.24 146th 2040 66.47 148th 2050 68.61 150th 2060 68.46 152nd 2070 66 154th 2080 61.48 156th 2090 55.31 158th 2100 48.07 160th

Nicaragua Average Life Expectancy

What is the Average Life Expectancy in Nicaragua ?

Average Life Expectancy in Nicaragua is 76.377 and is expected to Increase in upcoming next 50 years.

Life Expectancy is above average when compared to global average (Currently Hong Kong Ranks 1st for Life Expectancy of 85 years).

Nicaragua ranks 79th in terms of average life expectancy around the world.

Table : Past and Expected Average Life Expectancy (Age) (Source)

Year Average Life Expectancy Rank 2010 73.69 90th 2020 76.37 79th 2030 78.61 72nd 2040 80.68 67th 2050 82.6 63rd 2060 84.25 60th 2070 85.62 59th 2080 86.85 57th 2090 88.02 56th 2100 0

Nicaragua Average Fertility Rate

What is the Average Fertility Rate of Nicaragua ?

In Nicaragua, Women gives birth to 2.09 (average) children every year and this fertility rate is expected to be in decreasing trend.

Nicaragua rank is in range of 108th-165th in term of average fertility rate around the world.

Table : Past and Expected Average Fertility Rate

Year Average Fertility Rate Rank 2010 2.42 101st 2020 2.09 108th 2030 1.88 117th 2040 1.77 140th 2050 1.72 151st 2060 1.72 165th 2070 1.73 167th 2080 1.75 168th 2090 1.76 167th 2100 1.77 162nd

Conclusion of Analysis :

In 1950, Nicaragua population was 1294992 and this continuously increasing at growth rate of average 0.02%.Currently Nicaragua population is around 5737723 and by year 2030 its expected to be 7046293 .Nicaragua ranks 110th when compared to other countries population. Average Life Expectancy of Nicaragua in 2010 was 73.699, in 2020 its 76.377 and by 2050 it will be 82.6.As mentioned in Highlight's Nicaragua population is increasing, population density is increasing, average life expectancy is increasing and average fertility rate is decreasing.

Reference (Source) :

https://population.un.org/wpp/

https://population.un.org/wpp/DataSources/

https://www.wikipedia.org/

Historical population data on a sub-national level – including their administrative divisions and principal towns – is collected by Jan Lahmeyer and published at his website www.populstat.info.

The Minnesota Population Center publishes various high-quality datasets based on census data beginning in 1790. At the time of writing this source was online at www.pop.umn.edu/index.php. It focuses on North America and Europe.

The Data & Information Services Center (DISC) Archive at University of Wisconsin-Madison provides access to census data and population datasets (mostly for the Americas). At the time of writing this source was online at http://www.disc.wisc.edu.

The International Database published by the U.S. Census Bureau provides data for the time 1950-2100. At the time of writing this source was online at https://www.census.gov/data-tools/demo/idb/informationGateway.php.

The Atlas of the Biosphere publishes data on Population Density. At the time of writing this source was online at www.sage.wisc.edu/atlas/maps.
